If Christ is abiding in his [the teacher's] heart by faith, sin appears revolting. While he will have love, kindness, and tenderness for the scholars under his charge, he will feel that as a faithful servant he must discipline and preserve order in his class. If truth is cherished, the love of the Saviour is revealed in 
                                                                           180
his words and deportment. The word of God with him is not a dead letter; he will give not only lip service, but heart service.--TSS 25, 26,
